title: Modern Agriculture Technology: How Billions of Peaches Are Harvested and Processed by US Farmers

tasks.task: Farming tasks in peach orchards and processing facilities.
subtasks: Planting peach trees in late winter or early spring.
Soil preparation for peach trees.
Selecting peach tree varieties.
Pruning peach trees to promote growth and manage foliage.
Pollination using honeybees.
Assessing and thinning peach fruit density.
Harvesting peaches by hand.
Sorting peaches immediately after harvest.
Cooling harvested peaches to remove field heat.
Washing and inspecting peaches at packing facilities.
Sorting peaches by size and quality.
Blanching peaches for peeling.
Slicing and pitting peaches for processing.
Pruning peach trees by workers.
Harvesting peaches by hand.
Sorting peaches during harvest.

tasks.task: Transitioning peaches from farms to processing facilities.
subtasks: Transporting peaches from orchards to packing facilities.
Inspecting peaches at packing facilities.
Sizing and grading peaches for different products.
Packing peaches into bins or containers.
Selling peaches to consumers, wholesalers, or processing facilities.
